alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 1:48PM MST until August 02 at 2:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, Cochise and Graham. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Just over 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Ash Creek, Oak Creek, High Creek and Horton Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Cochise and Southern Graham Counties west of Bonita and Ft Grant south to near Interstate 10. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
